page.title: 11HALE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The Parish Councillors are chosen by vote every four years,the number, six,being determined by the number of people on the Electoral Roll. They meet each month in the Village Hall, although the law requires only four meetings a year. Currently the Council is concerned with the erosion of the verges by cars in Tethering Drove. The use of the Village Green also gives rise to many problems.Until February,1975 it was not known who legally owned the green. The Parish Council therefore held a ceremony in which the Chairman dug up a piece of earth on the Green and "seized the land for the benefit in perpetuity of the inhabitants of Hale". Before the District Planning Officer grants planning permission for build- ing the Councillors must approve it.
